lines.text: Oh, they're too heavenly! This necklace--where did you get it?
At a charity ball.
What courage!
No, merely nimble fingers. The lady stood beside me. The Prince of Wales was announced. I could have removed her dress.

As a matter of fact, I'm opposed to the American school of banditry. I studied in Paris. You have to work harder but you do acquire a certain finesse that is missing from the stick-em-up and shoot-them-down school.
What a shame to meet a man like that in a shop.
Why a shame?
He's the sort of robber one should meet in a Pullman!
What do you mean?
Didn't you see in the paper?
No!
Last week an American woman was robbed in the Simplon Express. Stripped right down to her teddies!
*No*!
What would you do if you found yourself in your teddies?
What would *you* do??
Let the train go on!

[laughing]
Lost soul!
When I'm travelling at the rate of 80 miles per hour, I'm not responsible for my actions.
They are silly to expect a woman to tell the truth about what happened when she was alone with a man!
There now, you can go!
Be displeased with me! I can't help it. I'm a respectable woman and I'm afraid.
Don't you think I'm afraid? I shan't close my eyes all night.
Well, this is *one* night I shall be very glad to be with my husband!
This is awful!
Why? I'm having a very good time. Won't you sit down?
You behave exactly as though you were paying a call!
I am. After a very brief and informal introduction, I'm now making a formal call.
Through the window...
But only to preserve your reputation. I came very discreetly by way of a drain pipe.
That's not legal!
The last place anybody would think of looking for me is in your bedroom.
Oh, so you expect to stay here until morning?
I'm forced to. Tomorrow the chase starts all over again. I must have a peaceful night.
A peaceful night in *my bedroom?*

[smoking a 'funny' cigarette, using two phones, one at each ear]
Hello. Hello. Hello. This is Napoleon.
Always be suspicious. Don't be fooled by anybody. Anything strange, if it ain't more than a mouse's whisker -- call the police.
There's a man for you!
You're so lovely. It's hard to be brutal with you.
You do strike a fresh note. Up to now, men have always been brutal because I am lovely!

[observing diamond rings being placed onto velvet cushions by Hollander]
Oh look! All the little jewels going virtuously to bed for Papa!
Their Papa prefers them less virtuous. There's no profit in sleeping at home.
A-ha! I must remember that!
I'm curious to know how you were led astray.
Well, I began life as a little boy--
I'm glad to hear that you kept to the same sex.
Yes. It's a family tradition.
My contract said I was to watch out for burglars, not directors.

[with a nameless introduction, proposing a toast]
Merely man.
Merely woman.
And to whatever joins them.
I'm hungry
That's because you were frightened. There's nothing like a little fear to whet one's appetite.

[looking vaguely surprised after a gentle slap by Baroness Teri]
How intimate.
Now, would you be so kind as to introduce me to you?
Which one of me?

[being threatened by Teri's gun]
Do you want to make a pool of blood?
If you insist.

[being seduced by Robber]
Show me your jewels.
Of course.
